topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d9ad57636872747d4d0000#post_53d9ad57636872747d4d0000
[bq="Princess♠Molestia"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d9abee63687254ab600100#post_53d9abee63687254ab600100

Seems plausible if it's something like that. Though the flesh eating part sounds really far fetched for real life.

Humans going absolutely nutso? Eerily plausible.[/bq]
In last of us they based the fungus off this fungus that infect ants.  Basically what the fungus does is that it infect the ant's brain and forces them to go to a high place so that when the ant dies the fungus can spread through the air.


It's highly doubtful that fungus would ever make the jump to humans, but if it did gg human race.

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d9af396368724ee5d30000#post_53d9af396368724ee5d30000
[bq="Princess♠Molestia"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d9ae936368726870760100#post_53d9ae936368726870760100

That would be terrifying.[/bq]
If the fungus were to jump to humans you know what would be the most effective way of stopping it?  A flamethrower; I'm not joking either.  If a house had the spores you would see the cdc burning down buildings and houses to prevent the spread of the spores.


Speaking of diseases; doctors without borders has pulled out of trying to offer support for the Ebola victims in Africa.  Why?  Shit has hit the fan to the point that it was almost brought to the USA and this is essentially the "oh shit!" point.  Liberia is shutting down schools and is shifting towards shutting down a lot of services to try to slow down the outbreak.

Basically if you're wondering why this is a problem this is the "oh shit we seriously can't contain it" point at which everything starts to get locked down.  I would not be surprised if the countries where the infection is going on shut down their airports soon.
